Corrigendum to AVSEC Circular No. 25/2004

Subject: Minimum Standards for —Civil__—_ Aviation
Security Equipment.

With reference to this Bureau's AVSEC Circular No. 25/2004 dated
27.12.2004(Appendix 'F'- regarding In-line Hold Baggage Screening System) and in
exercise of powers conferred by Section SA of the Aircraft Act, 1934, delegated to
him vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation Notification No. 1797 dated
July 3, 1997, Commissioner of Security(Civil Aviation), for the purpose of securing
the aircraft operations at the civil airports in India, directs that :-

i) Para 2.1 Appendix-F, AVSEC Circular No. 25/2004 shall remain
suspended till further orders; and

ii) All the airport operators shall ensure that 100% baggage images from
level- | of In-line Hold Baggage Screening System are referred to level-2
for image interpretation by certified screeners for acceptance or
rejection. Adequate work stations and screeners for level-2 will be
provided for. a

iii) The machine is to be set to the algorithm (software) having highest
calibration availabledifppresent in the system.
